byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Annie Correal, Jeffrey E. Singer, Michael Winerip and Vivian Yee.

abstract: Clearer picture emerges of Felix David, Manhattan man who was fatally shot as police attempted to arrest him on suspicion of robbery; David was itinerant man with long history of mental illness, including paranoid schizophrenia; detective Harold Carter, who shot David, had been made aware of his condition prior to incident.
lead_paragraph: David Felix, a robbery suspect who lived in housing for the mentally ill, fought two officers for five minutes before being shot, officials said.

headline.main: Suspect Fatally Shot by Detective in East Village Had Mental Illness and a Troubled Past
headline.print_headline: Suspect Fatally Shot by Detective Had Mental Illness and a Troubled Past

snippet: David Felix, a robbery suspect who lived in housing for the mentally ill, fought two officers for five minutes before being shot, officials said.

keywords.value: Carter, Harold (New York, NY, Police Officer)
keywords.name: persons
